Comments_List: A better understanding of the pathophysiology of a few vascular diseases and ways this can be modeled. I also learned a few new quantitative techniques.

I got an amazing perspective of skills I already had in a much needed context. I learned how to really use my mathematical mindset to really solve relevant problems. I cannot wait to apply all this in the future.

The class is small, which made it easier for Professor Humphrey to ensure everyone was understanding the material before moving on. I found the printed notes really helpful to follow along with that time and would have liked having those throughout the course because I can spend more time in class trying to understand everything rather than having keep up writing the notes from the board.

I found the printed notes really helpful to follow along with that time and would have liked having those throughout the course because I can spend more time in class trying to understand everything rather than having keep up writing the notes from the board.

strengths: wonderfully taught and explained
weakness: not as structured as syllabus suggested

I would recommend this course to another student looking for a good BME elective. Professor Humphrey has incredible knowledge in the area. Even though I don't plan on pursuing research in this area, the knowledge and skills I learned are still useful for my career.
